intro: Gouania croatii, commonly known as the Croatian goania, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Balkan region, particularly found in parts of Croatia and neighboring countries. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Gouania croatii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
